title: Authors and Citation
text: Shah R (2023). shinyRatings: Intuitive Way Providing Star Rating 'shiny' App. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {shinyRatings: An Intuitive Way of Providing Star Rating in a 'shiny' App},   author = {Ronak Shah},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

what: An Intuitive Way of Providing Star Rating in a shiny App
title: An Intuitive Way of Providing Star Rating in a shiny App
text: ever needed way review things shiny ? Look , shinyRatings package built make process easy. also possible give 1/2 stars. Output
code: library(shiny) library(shinyRatings)  ui <- fluidPage(   shinyRatings('star1', no_of_stars = 7, default = 5),    textOutput('text1'),    shinyRatings('star2',default = 3, disabled = TRUE),    textOutput('text2'),  )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   output$text1 <- renderText({paste("No. of stars : ", input$star1)})   output$text2 <- renderText({paste("No. of stars : ", input$star2)}) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Include ratings in shiny UI — shinyRatings
text: inputId input slot used access value number stars. no_of_stars Number stars want display UI. default Number stars selected default. disabled Keep number stars fixed? Disable option changing values

title: Include ratings in shiny UI — shinyRatings
Include ratings in shiny UI — shinyRatings
code: if(interactive()){  library(shiny)  library(shinyRatings)  ui <- fluidPage(   shinyRatings('star'),    textOutput('text') )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    output$text <- renderText({paste("No. of stars : ", input$star)}) }  shinyApp(ui, server) }
